answerText: ice [prompt on solid water][10] These chunks of ice are bounced around a cloud by updrafts and downdrafts, and grow as raindrops freeze upon collision. The largest one ever measured was one point six seven pounds and was a foot and a half wide.
heading: DEES |2014 | Editors 3 + UCSD | 4 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An ivu is a sudden wind-driven rush of a large amount of this material onto a lakeshore, which is also called a "shove" of this material.  [10] Identify this material that makes up frazil, a needle-like substance found in cold, turbulent waters.
